publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-521 Pauline McNeill: Excell Call Centre, Glasgow—That the Parliament expresses deep concern over health and safety and employment practice at Excell Call Centre in Glasgow; deplores the sacking and intimidation of staff who have exposed Excell’s record; awaits with interest the report of the Health and Safety Executive inquiry into Call Centres, and calls for an inquiry into the operations of Excell in relation to 999 emergency services.
S1M-521 Excell Call Centre, Glasgow (lodged on 9 February 2000) Mr John McAllion*

S1M-521 Pauline McNeill: Excell Call Centre, Glasgow-That the Parliament expresses deep concern over health and safety and employment practice at Excell Call Centre in Glasgow; deplores the sacking and intimidation of staff who have exposed Excell's record; awaits with interest the report of the Health and Safety Executive inquiry into Call Centres, and calls for an inquiry into the operations of Excell in relation to 999 emergency services. Supported by: Mr John McAllion, Mr Duncan McNeil*
S1M-521 Excell Call Centre, Glasgow (lodged on 9 February 2000) Trish Godman*, Cathy Jamieson*

S1M-521 Pauline McNeill: Excell Call Centre, Glasgow—That the Parliament expresses deep concern over health and safety and employment practice at Excell Call Centre in Glasgow; deplores the sacking and intimidation of staff who have exposed Excell’s record; awaits with interest the report of the Health and Safety Executive inquiry into Call Centres, and calls for an inquiry into the operations of Excell in relation to 999 emergency services. Supported by: Mr John McAllion, Mr Duncan McNeil, Trish Godman, Cathy Jamieson
S1M-521 Excell Call Centre, Glasgow (lodged on 9 February 2000) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-521 Excell Call Centre, Glasgow (lodged on 9 February 2000) Elaine Smith*

S1M-521 Pauline McNeill: Excell Call Centre, Glasgow—That the Parliament expresses deep concern over health and safety and employment practice at Excell Call Centre in Glasgow; deplores the sacking and intimidation of staff who have exposed Excell’s record; awaits with interest the report of the Health and Safety Executive inquiry into Call Centres, and calls for an inquiry into the operations of Excell in relation to 999 emergency services. Supported by: Mr John McAllion, Mr Duncan McNeil, Trish Godman, Cathy Jamieson, Tommy Sheridan, Elaine Smith
S1M-521 Excell Call Centre, Glasgow (lodged on 9 February 2000) Donald Gorrie*

S1M-521 Pauline McNeill: Excell Call Centre, Glasgow—That the Parliament expresses deep concern over health and safety and employment practice at Excell Call Centre in Glasgow; deplores the sacking and intimidation of staff who have exposed Excell’s record; awaits with interest the report of the Health and Safety Executive inquiry into Call Centres, and calls for an inquiry into the operations of Excell in relation to 999 emergency services. Supported by: Mr John McAllion, Mr Duncan McNeil, Trish Godman, Cathy Jamieson, Tommy Sheridan, Elaine Smith, Donald Gorrie
S1M-521 Excell Call Centre, Glasgow (lodged on 9 February 2000) Rhoda Grant*
S1M-521 Excell Call Centre, Glasgow (lodged on 9 February 2000) Cathy Peattie*

S1M-521 Pauline McNeill: Excell Call Centre, Glasgow—That the Parliament expresses deep concern over health and safety and employment practice at Excell Call Centre in Glasgow; deplores the sacking and intimidation of staff who have exposed Excell’s record; awaits with interest the report of the Health and Safety Executive inquiry into Call Centres, and calls for an inquiry into the operations of Excell in relation to 999 emergency services. Supported by: Mr John McAllion, Mr Duncan McNeil, Trish Godman, Cathy Jamieson, Tommy Sheridan, Elaine Smith, Donald Gorrie, Rhoda Grant, Cathy Peattie
